pages.text: Megalograptus is a famous sea scorpion from the Late Ordovician period. Some specimens were so well preserved, life colorations could be inferred from them. Those colors were inferred to be a dark brown and black on its tail and pincers and a lighter body coloration. They also had a trident like tail and their arms had a multitude of spines on them.
